title: TxPool with invalid pending transactions
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.10.26-stable
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour

Incoming transactions can pass all validation checks in TxPool, but they may not pass `preCheck` stage. These transactions should be removed from TxPool.

#### Actual behaviour

A transaction that has not passed `StateTransition.preCheck` stage, remains pending until it is replaced with another transaction from the same sender or dropped by timeout.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I started private PoA network, and explicitly added a new test check to the `state_transition.go` file.

```go
func (st *StateTransition) preCheck() error {
    if st.msg.Value().Uint64() == 100 {
        return fmt.Errorf("ERROR")
    }
    ...
}
```

Now all transactions with `value` == 100 are invalid. But TxPool keeps these transactions.
